name: Law applicable to all courts
text:
§652-15  Law applicable to all courts.  This chapter and the powers conferred therein shall extend to all the common-law courts of the State, according to their jurisdiction. [L 1876, c 35, §13; RL 1925, §2844; RL 1935, §4283; RL 1945, §10315; RL 1955, §237-15; HRS §652-15]
 
Case Notes
 
  "Common law courts" are those in contradistinction to courts of equity; district court has jurisdiction in proper cases.  19 H. 625 (1909).  See also 22 H. 229 (1914).
